Short Story - Old Man In Space

\

\ Guiding his thoughts toward a distant solar system billions of miles away, the sphere responded seamlessly. As the smaller orbs adjusted their positions around him in harmonious synchrony, a resonant sound began to emerge—a deep, rising hum that was not mechanical but organic, like the voices of hundreds of synchronized singers imitating the crescendo of a jet engine. It was magnificent, a celestial choir that echoed like distant thunder, amplifying the sense of anticipation. A surge of exhilaration coursed through him—the thrill of the uncharted, the promise of the adventure that lay ahead.\

\ The helmet—once a simple box now transformed—melded seamlessly with his mind, its advanced capabilities responding intuitively to his every thought.\

\ This was just the beginning.\
